result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine D. Gooch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Shenanigan's Tavern or w/ faimily members of the victims.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:47pm-  State is compliant with victim rights notification.
Count 1-  Defendant is sentenced to 20 years in the WSP: 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision w/ conditions.  Credit for 493 days.
Count 3-  Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP: 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision w/ conditions - consecutive to count 1.
Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered on each count.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
from Regina Evans
from sister of DE   (no name on letter)

Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  10/5/2015 JT removed from the court's calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Bond continued.
At the request of ADA Braun, plea hearing is scheduled for 9/29/2015 at 2:30pm.  State to notify Attorney Jensen.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Dirk Jensen. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearing held jointly with 14CF751. Atty. Jensen objects to preliminary hearing held with 14CF751. Court notes and over-rules objection. Preliminary hearings held jointly for judicial economy. KPD Det. Daniel Bandi sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Jensen. State offers and Court receives exhibits S-1, S-2, S-3, S-4, S-5, and S-6. Probable cause found. State to file information within statutory time limits. Arraignment on 8-13-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
Dirk Jensen
